intro: Saussurea soczavae, commonly known as the Soczava saffron, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Eastern Carpathian Mountains in Romania. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, yellow-orange inflorescence that resembles saffron. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its flowers are small and tubular, arranged in a compact cluster, and it produces a distinctive, aromatic scent. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
